channel.title: Updates on John J Mercer
channel.description: Recent content in Updates on John J Mercer

item.title: Upcoming Public Events
item.description: All events are at the Benson Masonic Temple (5903 Maple St) unless otherwise noted. January 6, 2024 Annual Officer Installation 2:00 PM February 2, 2024 Benson First Friday: Artist Markets 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM (No burrito sales this month) March 1, 2024 Benson First Friday: Artist Markets & BURRITOS ARE BACK! (Lodge Building Tours at 7:00 and 8:00 PM) 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM April 5, 2024 Benson First Friday: Artist Markets & Breakfast Burritos

item.title: Hall Rental
item.description: The Benson Masonic Temple’s dining hall is available for rent for your event. The hall is open for rent on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays unless an event is already scheduled. Some facts, photos and further information about the hall are outlined below. If, after reading the information below, you have additional questions, please email us at bensonmasonsrental@gmail.com. If you wish to submit a request to rent the hall, please click on the link below and fill out the request form.

item.title: Photos
item.description: 2023 Nebraska Masonic All-Star Marching Band Camp Mercer Men replace the flag at the entrance to the Creative District of Benson 2023 Annual Communication {.has-text-align-center} The Mercer Men, front and center, at the Grand Master’s Q&A Session.

item.title: Bronze Jordan Medal
item.description: Mercer’s Bronze Jordan Medal Holder: Bro. Richard Johnson {.has-text-align-center} The Bronze Jordan Medal is presented to the member of the subordinate lodge who is a Master Mason in good standing and has the longest period of membership.

item.title: Notables
item.description: 2023 Rock Maul Award (Large Lodge) John J. Mercer Lodge No. 290 2023 Gold Pan Award Individual Masonic Achievement Award WB Roger Manley

item.title: 2024 Officers
item.description: Elected and Appointed Lodge Officers <img src="https://www.bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--819x1024.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-495" srcset="https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--819x1024.jpg 819w, https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--240x300.jpg 240w, https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--768x960.jpg 768w, https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--1229x1536.jpg 1229w, https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451--1200x1500.jpg 1200w, https://bensonmasons.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/2024010621435652-4402446112668130451-.jpg 1638w" sizes="(max-width: 819px) 100vw, 819px" /><figcaption>Michael was raised at John J. Mercer Lodge in 2014. Bro. Barnes was awarded the Titanium Trowel in 2021 after a brief hiatus, thus returning to become an active and integral part of Mercer. Michael&#8217;s dedication to preserving the reputation of the Fraternity is cherished by its Brethren.

item.title: The Patron Saints and the Point Within A Circle
item.description: John J. Mercer Lodge No. 290 is selling prints of the painting “The Patron Saints and the Point within A Circle” commissioned by the Lodge in 2014. For more information on this inspirational work of Masonic art, please have a look at the Interview with W. Bro. David Long. Shipping Information All prints are shipped in 24″ x 4″ mailing tubes using ground shipping. Each print is rolled in interleaving paper to prevent damage to the print in transit.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: <p> General Inquiries: <a href="mailto:info@bensonmasons.com">info@bensonmasons.com</a> </p> <p> Hall Rental Inquiries:<br /><a href="mailto:bensonmasonsrental@gmail.com">bensonmasonsrental@gmail.com</a> or (402) 553-0679 </p> <p> 5903 Maple St.<br />Omaha, NE 68104 </p> <p> <br />NOTE: If you plan to visit the Lodge in person, please make sure to schedule an appointment. </p> <!-- .wpforms-container -->

item.title: About
item.description: AS FREEMASONS The Brethren of John J. Mercer Lodge No. 290 believe that while there are many different paths a Freemason may follow – educational, ritual, community, philanthropy, etc. – the best way to observe the Craft is through a Brotherhood focused on learning and understanding our ritual and then applying its teachings to ourselves and to the communities in which we live. To that end, Mercer places a strong emphasis on tangible Masonic education and are purposeful in the selection of candidates to join us in this great and good work.

item.title: John J. Mercer Lodge | A.F. & A.M. of Nebraska
